instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2915: Stock on Progress Bar
threads.message:
Hello

Working on a 820-2915. Had two issues originally, first was GPU related, lines across screen, which has been repaired (rebelled GPU).

Second issue is it boots up to progress bar but never boots completely into OS. I've check and confirmed no corrosion present or sign of liquid spills.

Could anyone please assist with cleaning up the EFI bios file that i've attached. I can't seem to find a clean ME region for this version.  

[url]https://drive.google.com/open?id=1YKM4stXmFjoKO1h7VlU4WglAv5hoV1Sl[/url]

Thanks a lot.

threads.title: 820-2915: Stock on Progress Bar
threads.message:
Try this and comment.
[url]https://drive.google.com/open?id=1iyo2m1OTl7BeAvS-TtMyI7MDE0YD0xcN[/url]

You can have GPU issue too; if reballed chip, not really new...

threads.title: 820-2915: Stock on Progress Bar
threads.message: 2informaticos thanks for the efi file. Confirmed the issue is still with the GPU chip.

threads.title: 820-2915: Stock on Progress Bar
threads.message:
Get Tiresias GPUkiller and disable GPU.
Latest Medusa programmer can also disable GPU; but only survives untill first PRAM reset...

threads.title: 820-2915: Stock on Progress Bar
threads.message: Wow didn?t know these existed. Awesome. Getting it. Thanks
